name: Holiday Inn Norwich

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Typical chain hotel.
reviews.title: Is Pimms the same as Campari???

reviews.text: We were upgraded as our room had been given out wrongly to other people booking in before us, so actually that was good, as it was very spacious with a sofa, although the bathroom was tiny - difficult to get two people in there at the same time....The main problem was the bed which was far too soft for my back, giving me severe problems every morning of the three nights we stayed there.
reviews.title: Business accommodation

reviews.text: We had asked when booking, for a room accessible by lift, but this did not transpire, presumably because our original room had been gievn to others (I only realised I had asked for this when I got home and was typing this up against our order through booking.com).
reviews.title: expensive and small uncomfortable beds

reviews.text: Very reasonable rates for weekend, but thought that the adequate breakfast was overpriced.
reviews.title: Good value, pity breakfast not included. Waitress forgot to get dressed?

reviews.text: We did not dine in as we tend to avoid hotel chain formula food.
reviews.title: Its the staff that make this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just spent a long weekend. This is about our 5th. stay and we always find that from Jo in reservations to George in the bar everything was wonderful as usual. I am disabled and everyone is so patient and understanding. We would recommend this hotel whether or not you are disabled. Note-The breakfast would be hard to beat anywhere.
reviews.title: A visit from Oxfordshire

reviews.text: Visited here for a friends wedding and it was a lovely wedding, the room was lovely, food was fantastic we had a three course meal and the choices were fab.The staff were all very friendly and helpful and could not do enough to make our friends day special. We stayed over noght and the room was clean and spacious. Breakfast was lovely, the choice was very good. Fried food, continental, yogurts, fruit and cereals. We also used the pool and sauna and steam room, all were very clean. I would definetly recommend a wedding here and also staying over night.
reviews.title: Wedding and overnight stay

reviews.text: We were Nana, Granddad, Son and two granddaughters - 11 & 6, who stayed for 4 nights in August. We had adjoining rooms which was so nice as our son and granddaughters could come and go from their room to ours. It was also a plus that the girls could be put to bed and our son could come into our room to spend the evening with us, while knowing that his girls were safe, just through the door. The rooms were clean and well appointed, the beds comfortable. All the staff we had contact with were very friendly. Our oldest granddaughter had her 11th birthday while we were staying and all staff wished her happy birthday and enquired after her day. Breakfast was amazing, a huge selection - the girls loved the pancake making machine. We also enjoyed an evening meal in the dinning room and two evenings ordered room service. The pool and spa were also a big hit for us. Our son is a platinum card member and will no doubt be using the Holiday Inn chain again. As we are from New Zealand it could be some time before we are again in the UK but would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Fun With Family

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights, lovely hotel very clean. Staff extremely friendly and helpful, especially Jane on reception and restaurant team. Stayed with elderly aunt so had 2 rooms on ground floor, very quiet. Both good size, comfy large bed, good drawers and wardrobe space. Only downside is that bathroom was very small although very clean. Evening meal in Restaurant very good and breakfast is superb, lots of choice, hot and cold. Restaurant staff very attentive, quick to clear tables and top up tea/coffee. Met up with family so didnt have time to use spa or pool.
reviews.title: Chain friendly hotel

reviews.text: We booked in the last minute, so we got a disabled room, set up for one instead of two. There wasnt any phonesignal in the room, so we couldnt do any calls and internet. The shower wasnt enough powerful, but the bed was comfy.
reviews.title: A chain friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with my Fiance for 2 nights last week as it really is a nice place to stay and central to most places. I stay here about 3 times a year with my mum as we come up for long weekend shopping trips to Norwich and have never had any problems here. Very friendly staff that we all know now, rooms are always spotless, food in bar and restaurant is fantastic!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: The bedroom was spotless which was really nice to see as many hotels aren't anywhere near the expected standard of cleanliness they should be! Though the gentleman on the bar and the lady on reception in the evening were very professional and well presented but neither were genuinely friendly which for me really let me down due to the fact I work on Reception and the bar in another hotel and I know how important it is to show people you care and it changes the whole experience. Another let down was the fact we had to ask to get our table cleaned after we sat down in the bar!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel!
Comfortable stay
reviews.text: Would definitely stay here again due to it being so close to my sister and the high quality of cleanliness in the room but the friendliness on staff could definitely be improved!

We stayed in an executive room perfect for a family of 4. When we arrived the bed was made and 4 towels etc which is good. Breakfast was very good. The stickers for the children was a nice touch. Staff all friendly and professional
reviews.title: Comfortable stay, professional staff

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights for family wedding, room was clean and comfortable - and although the crazy wooden panels were a variation to conventional curtains they did the job better and kept the light out so we could sleep for longer.
reviews.title: Poor service
A chain friendly hotel
reviews.text: The hotel has very polite and friendly staff who want to make sure your stay is as good as possible. The rooms are clean, although the double bed was small for two adults and was noisy due to being at the start of a corridor and having an fan outside the window. However, that aside it is certainly worth a stay and is only a few miles from the centre of Norwich. One point to note the so called free Internet is so slow that you end up paying for the high speed. When will UK hotels realise that this should be a service not a cost.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel and it's grounds were well kept. The room was clean if a little tired. The bathroom/shower/toilet was very small and cramped, OK for two but for a family would have been difficult. The air conditioning in the room was very welcome.
reviews.title: On the whole an enjoyable stay

reviews.text: The staff were excellent, as was the service, and the food was the best we've had in any hotel.. My only criticism is the 'discretionary' 10% service charge on drinks, (which are already very expensive) even if you are at the bar.
reviews.title: A poor start but enjoyed my stay

reviews.text: I arrived at the hotel for a 2 night stay and have to say the exterior is off-putting, very 70s swimming baths style, once I got inside the public areas were very nice and look recently modernised.
reviews.title: Well situated hotel

reviews.text: I got into my room which had threadbare sofas and a stained and torn bed base and was fairly underwhelmed, I then discovered the inter-connecting door to the next room had been left unlocked and it took 30 minutes of chasing to get it locked. When the duty manager arrived to unlock this and I queried why it had taken so long he said it wasn't his fault and I would have to talk to the manager - no apology.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel!

description: Holiday Inn Norwich enjoys an excellent location only 2.5 miles south from Norwich city centre. This Norwich Hotel offers easy access to attractions such as Great Yarmouth, Snetterton; Norwich City FC and Sandringham House & Gardens. This Norwich hotel combines excellent facilities for both business and leisure users, including Kids eat and stay for free*.The Hotel facilities include 119 Air Conditioned hotel Bedrooms, High Speed Internet access in bedrooms, conference rooms and public areas. This hotel in Norwich offers family rooms and accessible rooms too.Holiday Inn, Norwich has 5 meeting rooms which can cater for many requirements for up to 150 people, from Meetings, Christenings, Family Birthdays, Funerals to Weddings. Ample free car parking is available. The Hotel offers a Gym, Sauna, Spa Bath and Indoor Heated 13m Swimming Pool and is complimented by an on-site beauty therapist (pre-booking recommended). The hotel restaurant allows you to dine in an informal atmosphere everyday; serving a full buffet breakfast and extensive dinner menu that caters for everyone. Whether you are looking for sight-seeing, shopping, or exploring the beautiful Norfolk countryside we have it all. Discover the hidden gem of East Anglia that is known as Norfolk. *Terms and conditions apply.
